sentences.expr: In our framework,  $y_{t}$  can be of one of two types: a visual word or a textual word, denoted as  $y^{vis}$  and  $y^{txt}$  respectively
sentences.label: definition

sentences.expr: A visual word  $y^{vis}$  is a type of word that is grounded in a specific image region drawn from  $\bm{r}_{\bm{I}}$
sentences.label: definition

sentences.expr:
In order to accommodate for these linguistic variations, the visual word  $y^{vis}$  in our model is a refinement of the category name by considering the following two factors:
First, determine the plurality – whether it should be singular or plural
sentences.label: definition
